etymologies: early 17th century: via Latin from Greek leikhēn

definitions: a simple slow-growing plant that typically forms a low crusty, leaflike, or branching growth on rocks, walls, and trees

examples.text: the cedars are festooned with lichen

notes.text: Lichens are composite plants consisting of a fungus that contains photosynthetic algal cells. Their classification is based upon that of the fungal partner, which in most cases belongs to the subdivision Ascomycotina, and the algal partners are either green algae or cyanobacteria. Lichens obtain their water and nutrients from the atmosphere and can be sensitive indicators of atmospheric pollution

definitions: a skin disease in which small pimples or bumps occur close together
shortDefinitions: skin disease in which small, hard round lesions occur close together
